summary: This is an email chain from July 23, 2020, regarding a FOIA request in the Epstein matter. An Associate Warden at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York is being asked to confirm they have no documentation relating to Epstein beyond what was already collected, and mentions having saved documentation in a folder due to multiple inquiries.

persons.name: Associate Warden
persons.role: Associate Warden at MCC New York
persons.context: The recipient of an email inquiry regarding documentation related to Jeffrey Epstein, confirming they have saved documentation on their drive and will send it separately.

events.title: FOIA Inquiry Regarding Epstein Documentation
events.description: An email inquiry is made to an Associate Warden at MCC New York regarding a FOIA request in the Epstein matter, asking them to confirm they have no additional physical or electronic documentation.

events.title: Epstein Incident at MCC
events.description: Reference to an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center last year, after which a litigation hold was sent.

keyFacts: A FOIA request in the Epstein matter prompted an inquiry to an Associate Warden at MCC New York on July 23, 2020.
The Associate Warden had received a litigation hold soon after the Epstein incident in 2019.
The Associate Warden created a folder with documentation on their h:drive due to several inquiries, noting it was too large to send in one email.
The inquiry asks the Associate Warden to confirm they have no physical or electronic documentation relating to Epstein other than what was in their email and MCC hard drive.
